Thursday 16th October

1.30pm – 4.30pm

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” custom_height=”20″][image_with_animation image_url=”22208″ image_size=”full” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default” animation_type=”entrance” animation=”Fade In” animation_easing=”default” animation_movement_type=”transform_y” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default”][divider line_type=”No Line”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]The Ecommerce Strategy Talks bring together creative entrepreneurs, tactical industry leaders, and technical advisors to ensure your business is ready to succeed in the age of online retailing. Through practical discussions and on-the-ground insight, attendees will learn how to build loyal customer bases, optimise operations to reduce costs, and leverage new tools and tech to drive sustainable growth.

Whether you’re launching your first online business, scaling an existing venture, or adapting to market changes, this event provides the tools and guidance any Black-owned business needs to succeed in the competitive ecommerce arena. This event is a true masterclass in ecommerce success strategies for both seasoned entrepreneurs and those entering the market.

Key themes:
1. Build loyal customer communities and maximise lifetime value through relationship-focused business models
2. Understand how to align your social channels and marketing strategies for a seamless customer journey that converts social browsers into active customers
3. Find opportunities to leverage AI and automation to reduce the burden of manual tasks and create efficiencies across operations
4. Refine your platform-based marketplace strategies to diversify revenue streams, reduce single channel dependency, and reach wider audiences
5. Effectively reach Black consumers by identifying where they shop, what they value, and how to authentically connect with these markets
[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color”][vc_custom_heading text=”Speakers” Susan Allen Augustin

Co-Founder & Chief Brand Officer, Here We Flo[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Susan Allen is Co-Founder & Chief Brand Officer of Here We Flo, a rapidly growing B Corp with big ambitions and an impressive roster of advisers and investors from Graze, Charlotte Tilbury, Unilever, L’Oréal, and more.

After meeting Tara Chandra, the two launched Here We Flo with a Kickstarter campaign in 2017. The brand has been shaking up the personal care category ever since, with a purpose-drive, period care, sensitive bladder, and sexual wellness range that offers ‘fiercely natural care for life’s messiest moments’.

Here We Flo is on a mission to challenge shame and disrupt the period, bladder, and sexual wellness markets with plant-powered products including tampons, pads, reusable period underwear, condoms, and more![/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Jamelia Donaldson

Founder and CEO, TreasureTress[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Jamelia Donaldson is Founder and CEO of TreasureTress, Europe’s largest subscription service dedicated to curly hair product discovery. TreasureTress not only addresses the lack of quality products for curly hair in the UK but also nurtures a vibrant and interconnected community that transcends geographical boundaries.

Jamelia’s influence extends far beyond TreasureTress. Recognizing the beauty industry’s disregard for Black and Multi-Ethnic consumers, she has spearheaded a consultancy arm within her company, empowering brands worldwide to establish authentic connections and find their rightful place within this underserved market. Jamelia’s expertise and transformative work has been featured in renowned publications such as Forbes, Buzzfeed, and The Times. Jamelia has also unveiled TreasureTress’ first official TREND REPORT: “The Untapped Opportunity: in the UK Afro Hair Market[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner Eni Awoyemi

Founder, feYi Flowers[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]feYi Flowers was born from love, creativity, and a desire to create floral  arrangements that truly resonate with modern women. The brand is named after Eni’s daughter, Feyi, meaning “my joy” in Yoruba, symbolising the heart and soul behind everything we do. 

Eni found it difficult to find a floral brand that matched her style. Many arrangements felt generic and overpriced, and the largely male-dominated floral industry offered few options for women like her. 

Determined to change that, Eni created feYi Flowers, a women-led brand designed for modern women. Offering unique, paper-wrapped bouquets that blend wellness, self-care, and a touch of fun. Through our fresh approach, we’re bringing new energy to the floral industry, celebrating individuality and joy. [/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Tommie Powers

“Tommie Traffic”, Entrepreneur & Investor[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Tommie Powers aka “Tommie Traffic” is an Entrepreneur & Investor with over 18 years experience. He’s helped his clients and partners use digital advertising to sell over $700M and counting while personally managing over $130M in adspend.

Realizing video was the future, he started buying ads on YouTube in 2012. By 2014, he had spent his first $1M on YouTube ads. Since then, he’s personally spent over $50M and counting just on YouTube ads alone in addition to training and mentoring over 1000 high level entrepreneurs and media buyers.

His clients and partners include entrepreneurs who bootstrapped from zero, top Silicon Valley VC firms, brands with Billion Dollar valuations, public figures who sold their companies for as much as 9 figures, and startups who have raised tens of millions of dollars.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Ade Ahmadu

Senior Manager, UK Customer Experience, eBay UK[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Ade Ahmadu is a Senior Manager in Business-to-Consumer Customer Experience at eBay UK, focused on enhancing the experience and growth of small and medium-sized business sellers on the platform. He leads initiatives to help businesses scale effectively while ensuring marketplace integrity and compliance.

With a background in financial services, technology, and pharmaceuticals, Ade brings extensive experience in business strategy, operational improvements, and seller engagement. Before joining eBay, he worked on large-scale transformation and regulatory programmes, shaping data-driven strategies to support business growth. He holds an Executive MBA from Warwick Business School, specialising in Strategic Leadership and is an accredited coach with Association for Coaches.

Ade enjoys travelling with his wife and two boys, exploring new places as a family. He is actively involved in music ministry at his church, loves cycling, and is passionate about mentoring, coaching, and leadership development.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Neeti Awasthi

Director of Business Sellers, eBay UK[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Neeti Awasthi leads the Business Sellers team at eBay UK, overseeing strategy, growth, and community engagement to support and empower business sellers on the platform. Since joining eBay in 2012, she has held senior leadership roles across Retail Standards and Business Operations, giving her a broad and nuanced perspective on the UK marketplace. Prior to eBay, Neeti held program and product management leadership roles across the UK, Europe, and South Asia. She loves empowering business sellers to succeed online, while fostering a sense of community and connection that helps them thrive.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Kemi Oloyede

Founder, Sew London Project[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Kemi Oloyede is a multi-award-winning fashion designer, educator, and eco-conscious social entrepreneur passionate about circular fashion and sustainability. She is the founder of Sew London Project and recently opened a Creative Repurpose Space at Vicarage Field Shopping Centre in Barking, where she continues to serve her local community through sewing workshops, fabric pop-ups, and upcycling events.

Expanding her mission online, Kemi runs the Recyclothes store on eBay, specialising in preloved fashion, upcycled textiles, vintage clothing, and antiques. Through Recyclothes, she is building a growing resale platform that gives garments and objects a second life, reduces waste, and makes sustainable style accessible to a wider audience. Guided by her mantra “Reduce Waste and Repurpose Lives,” Kemi inspires both young people and adults to rethink their relationship with clothes and fashion.

text_direction=”default”]

ProZECH

Sneaker & Streetwear Content Creator, Kicks Khronicles[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

ProZECH is a vibrant UK content creator & sneaker enthusiast with over 26M views cross platform, known for his humour and engaging storytelling. His content, from lively social media videos to the nostalgic ‘Kicks Khronicles’ podcast, captivates a 20k strong community with a mix of sneaker culture and personal narratives.

Vera-Jayne Nwajiaku

Founder, NonyelumVee[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Vera-Jayne Nwajiaku is a mum of three, a seasoned management consultant with over 25 years in technology leadership, and the founder of NonyelumVee, her eBay-based gift shop launched in 2021. With experience spanning financial services, government, media, travel, retail and pharmaceuticals, she combines corporate expertise with entrepreneurial creativity. Vera-Jayne has been a panelist at eBay Business Roadshows, regularly contributes at eBay Open events, and is part of eBay UK’s “Black in Bloom” hub, championing Black-owned businesses. Drawing on her own growth journey, she shares practical ecommerce strategies that help entrepreneurs improve visibility, build customer trust, and adapt to changing buyer behaviours. Inspired by the entrepreneurial spirit of her mother and aunties, she empowers others to grow ventures that balance family, community, and business success.

Krystal-Pebbles Kisubi

E-Commerce CRO Specialist[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Krystal-Pebbles Kisubi is a freelance E-Commerce CRO Specialist and former Senior E-Commerce Executive at Mous, where she managed site performance and optimisation across global Shopify stores. With an unconventional career shift from pharmacy into the digital space, she began building her expertise independently before moving into e-commerce strategy. She now partners with start-ups and established brands to design data-driven funnels and deliver measurable growth. Alongside client work, she is passionate about supporting young people and mission-driven initiatives, combining entrepreneurial spirit with a commitment to long-term, sustainable growth.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” disable_element=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” Dr Tru Powell

Multi-Award Winning Entrepreneur & Personal Branding Expert[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Dr. Tru Powell is a multi-award winning personal brand expert and creative entrepreneur. Tru has over 15 years in enterprise, the arts, and live events, and is very passionate about supporting the next generation of entrepreneurs to get visible and build their personal brands. As well as the Founder and Director of Tru Powell Consultancy & Events Ltd, Tru is the founder of the Inspire Awards. Previously, he served as the CEO of the Multicultural Business & Community Champion Awards (MBCC’s). He is also the CEO of the Black Business Magazine, a premier online and print publication dedicated to uplifting and empowering the Black community, and Director of Aston Performing Arts Academy. Alongside being a successful entrepreneur, Tru is very passionate about equality and often speaks publicly about what it means to be anti-racist.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” disable_element=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” Oyin Akiyini

Global Brand Director, Chivas Brothers [/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Oyin is curious, entrepreneurial and experienced in building brands that place culture and purpose at the heart of their consumers. With over 15 years in the industry working with brands such as Nike, Boiler room, Youtube, Apple Music and now leading the culture department for Chivas Regal. Oyin has made sure that engaging her audiences is reflected in everything she does. Oyin’s extensive understanding of youth culture has led her to working with some of the best taste makers across industries likes; fashion, music and drinks/alcohol space.
